content: mmmmeeeeoooowwww mmmmiiiissssssss ppppaaaatttttttteeeerrrrnnnn mmmmaaaatttteeeerrrriiiiaaaallllssss nnnneeeeeeeeddddeeeedddd * yarn of your choice preferably worsted weight or thicker cheap non-shiny acrylic is best for beginners i used jo-ann sensations dolcetto for the purple kitty and bernat haven for the white kitty * crochet hook of your choice-my choice is a bamboo hook size e * plastic animal eyes the pictured kitties have 9mm eyes * embroidery yarn for the face * darning needle * straight pins * polyfill stuffing * felt scraps if you want to make the nose like the purple abbreviations chain = chain stitch single_crochet = single_crochet stitch increase = increase 2 single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease l single_crochet over two stitches tbl = through back loops creates shaping sl = slip_stitch pull up a loop and through the loop on hook = repeat everything enclosed in stars the listed number of * times after the star hhhheeeeaaaadddd round 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook round 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 round 3 *single_crochet 1 increase 1* repeat 5 times 18 round 4 *single_crochet 2 increase 1* repeat 5 times 24 round 5 *single_crochet 3 increase 1* repeat 5 times 30 round 6 *single_crochet 4 increase 1* repeat 5 times 36 round 7 *single_crochet 5 increase 1* repeat 5 times 42 round 8-12 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 42 round 13 *single_crochet 5 decrease 1* repeat 5 times 36 round 14 *single_crochet 4 decrease 1* repeat 5 times 30 position the eyes and begin stuffing after this row or the opening will be too small to work with round 15 *single_crochet 3 decrease 1* repeat 5 times 24 round 16 *single_crochet 2 decrease 1* repeat 5 times 18 round 17 *single_crochet 1 decrease 1* repeat 5 times 12 round 18 *decrease every stitch around* repeat 6 times 6 finish off and leave a long tail for sewing this is what it should look this is where you should like after row 2 insert your hook for a stitch another view of where to this shows a decrease pull put your needle forgive up a loop in the next stitch then the band-aid in the one after that and pull through all
